intro: Rothmannia keithii, commonly known as Keith's Rothmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, brightly colored flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Rothmannia keithii is appreciated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ecological importance for pollinators.
